title: George Clooney declares Donald Trump and Steve Bannon the real ‘Hollywood elitists’ | National Post
text:
George Clooney declares Donald Trump and Steve Bannon the real ‘Hollywood elitists’ Sadaf Ahsan | February 22, 2017 12:22 PM ET FarkIt 
Never one to keep his feelings on Donald Trump quiet, having previously dubbed the U.S. president an “opportunist” and “xenophobic fascist,” George Clooney had fresh words for the billionaire this week. 
In an interview with French news network Canal+ , Clooney hit out at Trump for condemning Meryl Streep’s political comments at this year’s Golden Globes since he himself is an elite member of Hollywood. 
“There’s a really interesting argument, this is the part that makes you a little crazy,” Clooney said. “When Meryl spoke, everyone on that one side was, ‘Well that’s elitist Hollywood speaking.’ Donald Trump has 22 acting credits in television … He collects $120,000 a year in his Screen Actors Guild pension fund. Uhh?! He is a Hollywood elitist.” 
In fact, according to his financial disclosure during the election campaign, Trump has a $110,228 pension from the Screen Actors Guild — not totally off the mark. 
Clooney dubbed Trump a “demagogue,” adding that Streep “has every right to speak up” since “she was an American citizen long before she was an icon.” Related George Clooney hits out at Donald Trump, labels him ‘an opportunist’ and ‘a xenophobic fascist’ 
Clooney, who endorsed Hillary Clinton during the 2016 election, then picked a few bones with Trump senior advisor Steve Bannon, saying, “Steve Bannon is a failed film writer and director. That’s the truth, that’s what he’s done. He wrote a Shakespearean rap musical about the LA riots that he couldn’t get made. He made a lot of money off of Seinfeld. He’s elitist Hollywood, I mean that’s the reality.” 
“We have Donald Trump, which is…hard to imagine,” Clooney concluded. “It catches in your throat. But we’ll fix it. We have to.”
